fields.headline: Annotated solutions for Genius 201
fields.bodyText: * In Victor Borge’s ‘Inflationary Language’ ‘four’ and ‘for’, for example, became ‘five’. Here, when the solutions defined in the clues that contain numbers (or homophones of numbers), these must be treated in the same way before entry in the grid. Across 5 phtwo-in/phone-in P(ublic)H(ouse) + TW  IN 7 captwo/Capone COWPAT (anag) 9 throatee/boat race THR  EE [brace/three] 10 Beirut B<(p)E{1}R(u)>UT 12 Eden draiNED Economy (hidden rev) 13 give rise to cryptic def 15 Incas IN CAS(e) 16 ale teA LEaves (hidden) 18 raccoon dog RA  G 19 Hutu (s)HUT/U(p) 21 myelin MY + NILE (rev) 22 go and see GOAN/D<(gange)S>EE 23 Nasdaq (liquidatio)N  Q(ueen) 24 mistime M  IME Down 1 Charles Dickens CH  ICKENS 2 fivenicnine/fornicate IF(rev)/VENIC<(desperation)N/IN>E 3 take six/take five cryptic def 4 fortyonetude/fortitude F  T YON ETUDE [40/41] 6 wham H(ard) in MAW (rev) 9 the sacrament THE  ME/N(ew)T(estament) 11 megalopolis GALOP/(tang)O in SMILE (anag) 17,14,8 fonidad and threebagursome/Trinidad and Tobago FO  URSOME [trio/foursome; to/three] 20 lnet/Lenin L + TEN (rev) [9/10]
